1.text: Peel russet potatoes and cut them into 1⁄4 inch (0.64 cm) thick sticks.

2.text: Put the fries in a bowl of cold water and refrigerate them for at least 1 hour.

3.text: Drain the fries and pat them dry with paper towels.

4.text: Pour oil into a heavy pot and heat it to 325 °F (163 °C).

5.text: Lower 1/3 of the fries into the oil and fry them for 3 to 4 minutes.

6.text: Transfer the fries to paper towels and par-fry the remaining batches.

7.text: Heat the oil to 375 °F (191 °C) and fry 1 batch of par-fried french fries for 3 to 4 minutes.

8.text: Fry the remaining batches of fries until they're crispy.

9.text: Put a baking sheet in the oven and preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C).

10.text: Peel 2 1⁄2 pounds (1.1 kg) of russet potatoes if you want crispy fries.

11.text: Cut the potatoes into 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) sticks.

12.text: Toss the french fries with olive oil and salt.

13.text: Arrange the fries on the hot sheet.

14.text: Bake the fries for 40 to 50 minutes, flipping them halfway.

15.text: Remove the fries and season them with more salt according to your taste.
